intro: Viola eriocarpa var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a hairy underside. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers with five petals, often arranged in a cluster at the top of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The species is characterized by its sessile leaves, which are attached directly to the stem without a stalk.
